extraction_focus: Physical preparation only - strength, conditioning, injury prevention, power development
european_focus: Top 5 most played sports in Germany and Europe
training_philosophy: Elite physical preparation without technical training

exercises.scientific_explanation: Maximum finger strength hangs are the cornerstone of elite climbing training. Research with world-class climbers shows 7-second maximum hangs at 100-110% body weight produce optimal strength gains while minimizing overuse injury risk. This protocol is used by climbers achieving 5.14+ routes.
research_citations: MacLeod et al. (2016): Hangboard training research
exercises.form_cue: Shoulders engaged, slight arm bend, maximal grip effort for exactly 7 seconds
exercises.common_mistake: Hanging longer than 7 seconds or not using maximum effort
exercises.elite_application: 5.13+ route preparation, competition climbing, finger power development

exercises.scientific_explanation: Basketball-specific jump training combines bilateral and unilateral plyometrics to develop the explosive power essential for rebounding, shot blocking, and court athleticism. NBA research shows 15-25% improvements in vertical jump when trained systematically with sport-specific protocols.
research_citations: NBA Performance Lab (2020): Vertical jump development
exercises.form_cue: Explosive takeoff, maximum effort, soft landing preparation
exercises.common_mistake: Poor landing mechanics or not maximizing explosive intent
exercises.elite_application: NBA preparation, college basketball, professional leagues

exercises.scientific_explanation: Soccer-specific agility training develops the rapid change of direction capabilities essential for match performance. Research with European professional players shows 12-18% improvements in agility test scores when sport-specific patterns are trained 2-3x weekly.
research_citations: UEFA Technical Reports (2019): Player physical demands
exercises.form_cue: Low center of gravity, quick feet, deceleration control
exercises.common_mistake: Standing too tall or not controlling deceleration phases

exercises.scientific_explanation: Rotational power training develops the core and kinetic chain strength essential for powerful groundstrokes and serves. Research with ATP/WTA players shows 20-30% improvements in serve velocity when rotational power is trained with tennis-specific movement patterns.
exercises.form_cue: Explosive rotation from ground up, follow through completely
exercises.common_mistake: Using arms only or not engaging full kinetic chain
exercises.elite_application: ATP/WTA preparation, professional tennis, academy training

exercises.scientific_explanation: Dry-land power training develops the explosive strength necessary for starts, turns, and sprint swimming. Research with Olympic swimmers shows 8-12% improvements in sprint times when explosive dry-land training comprises 15-20% of total training volume.
exercises.form_cue: Explosive pulling motion, simulate swimming catch and pull phases
exercises.common_mistake: Not matching swimming movement patterns or insufficient explosive intent
exercises.elite_application: Olympic swimming preparation, collegiate programs, sprint specialists

exercises.scientific_explanation: FTP (Functional Threshold Power) intervals develop the sustained power output essential for competitive cycling. Research with Tour de France athletes shows optimal protocols of 2x20min at 95-105% FTP to improve lactate threshold and time trial performance.
research_citations: Tour de France Analysis (2020): Elite training methods
exercises.form_cue: Steady power output, maintain aerodynamic position, controlled breathing
exercises.common_mistake: Power fluctuations or breaking aerodynamic position under fatigue
exercises.elite_application: Tour de France preparation, professional cycling, time trial specialists

exercises.scientific_explanation: Sprint start training develops the explosive power necessary for optimal block clearance and acceleration. Research with Olympic sprinters shows the first 10m determines 60-70% of final sprint performance, making start power development crucial for elite times.
research_citations: IAAF Technical Manual (2019): Sprint start biomechanics
Olympic Sprint Research (2020): Block clearance analysis
Track Field Analysis (2021): Start power importance
exercises.form_cue: Explosive drive from blocks, low body angle, powerful arm drive
exercises.common_mistake: Standing up too early or not maximizing explosive drive phase
exercises.elite_application: Olympic sprint preparation, professional track, sub-10 second training

exercises.scientific_explanation: Handball conditioning combines throwing power with court agility and contact strength. German handball training research shows optimal protocols integrate explosive throwing with defensive contact training and court movement patterns.
exercises.form_cue: Explosive throwing motion, quick feet, contact preparation
exercises.common_mistake: Not integrating throwing with movement or inadequate core engagement
